content.label:
Written on: June 22, 2018
I didn't really grow up with the final fantasy games so i'm not really going to sugarcoat anything on this review. I admit i did play the demo of final fantasy 10 for the ps2 when i was 10 so that's mostly all the knowledge i know of the franchise besides years later when final fantasy 3 came out for Ios. 

To start, this game is probably the most in-depth FF when it comes to the characters and how they interact with each other in terms of dialogue and their surroundings..you could really feel the desperation they felt as they went to each kingdom in this war-torn installment. The cutscenes were wonderfully placed and that helped to showcase the depressing violence of war. Unfortunately this is all the positives it has.
 
While i did enjoy the game and the cutscenes were great in showcasing what being mad with power could do, i also felt most of the game was rushed and didn't pace itself well with the characters. The story starts in the middle of the war with the other kingdoms without much backstory that explains "why" and "How" it all started. It would've been nice to see how the Queen was before the war and how the antagonist managed to sneak into her castle and influence her.. The game felt incomplete for that reason in my opinion and would've actually made me care about her and her daughters relationship. 
The characters backstories also never have that much weight to them other than them wanting to kill the antagonist for their own reasons. The only two characters out of the 8 playable ones that had a remotely lasting impact were "the black mage" and   main protagonist but mostly all the characters personalities never really change and aren't really fleshed out to where it seems like they matter in a story where the cutscenes are the most emotionally in-depth.

All in all, I'm glad i played it and it was one of the better ones in terms of world building, music and cutscenes but it ultimately fell flat on everything else. I played this on an iPhone 6s!

Not sure how I even missed this game in the PlayStation days. Great ending, great story, great game play. Brought me back to final fantasy II near the end. (FFIV) They turned materia grinding to gear grinding. Which can get repetitive adding mindless hours of game play, but they did give cheats to hurry it up if you like to.
These people never update and on iPhone X it looks horrible. They should do something.

All the negative reviews are mostly coming from crashes while folks are trying to run this game on old apple equipment (iPad 2)... Read the requirements people. Runs fine with my iPad Air 2 and iPhone 6s Plus. Thanks for bringing this game mobile Square Enix!

title.label: Excellent port of an excellent game!

content.label: I have not played FF9 in several years and I am very impressed with how well this iOS version performs. I played on an iPhone 7 and this game works surprisingly well on the mobile platform. The touch screen functionality is as good as you could hope for with the UI being slightly modified for the experience. The game didn’t crash a single time during my 48 hour play through so you can tell it was optimized very nicely. The game also has a handy auto save feature every time you enter a new room which is very convenient if you need to put your phone away on a whim. However I highly recommend to still do manual saves just in case you need them. What more is there to say? FF9 is such an amazing adventure and if you haven’t played it yet then go for it!
Ff8 to iOS plzzzzz
I’ve played this game since I was 5th grade. It was more than 15 years ago, but still in love with FF series. I wish they can reamake FFVIII and specially FFX.

I grew up playing this game on the PlayStation. It holds the first place position of my favorite game of all time. I love the music, the story, the graphics, the characters, the leveling system, the skills, the bestiary, etc. The app is great. It has some cheats if you’re into that and a few graphic upgrades but for the most part the game hasn’t changed. 5 of 5 will always play.

The game is fun but looks horrendous on the iPhone X. Please update to a new resolution. When my finger is on the touch pad and slides to the black boarders it kills the movement, which is a major hassle when moving. Thank you.

title.label: I only have about an hour into the game

content.label: Please release a update where doors or paths you can explore are highlighted with a red arrow through settings. An hour in and I’m annoyed with having to wall crawl to find all available paths. The level graphics are horrible because they don’t scale well with today’s displays. So this would be great. A simpler solution then the alternative. Which would be all new assets that support better resolution so things are not so muddy.

title.label: Not worth it in the end

content.label: This was a great game ruined by a needlessly difficult final boss that’s tacked on to the end of the game for no apparent reason. This is not my first rodeo. I know how to level up characters. The rest of the game went smoothly. This last boss (that doesn’t even factor into the story line at all) is totally impossible to beat. Not worth it in the end.

Such a fantastic game, and the mobile port makes it the definitive version for me. Love the UI, updated graphics, and the fact that I can play on the go. Completed my first play through with no flaws or problems, going back for a second play through to try my hand at all the side quests. Thank you Square! Keep ‘em coming! (HINT: FFVIII)

I’m unable to connect my iPhone 8 Plus to the cloud servers. I’ve tried my carrier network, as well as wifi, and the connection times out. I’m able to connect from my iPad Pro 1st Gen to the servers over wifi. I need the save files to continue playing from where I left off :(
iPhone X support please! 1 Star until any support is given.

Coming back after years to experience ff9 on iOS and seeing nothing has changed from the original was something else. I’m so stoked for the remake of ff7 especially after hearing a character remodel for cloud. Hopefully the goofy dialogue and comedy relief stays. Putting over 50 hours on ff9 not a single one wasted. Thank you for making it possible to revisit this title on iOS
Full console game on iPad, and it's worth the price. Can't wait to see Final Fantasy 10 on the App Store I just hope it runs on the iPad Air 1st generation.
Anyway you can put a full screen option for the iPhone X ???i love the game!!!
Favorite game of all time can you guys update the screen for iPhone X please!!!

This game is a must play. I don’t know why it isn’t an editors choice l, but if you are looking for an amazing story, great visuals, tons of hours of gameplay, and quality controls you can not go wrong here. I didn’t play this when it originally came out on console. So this was my first time through. I’m blown away by how great this was. So if you want a game to last you a long time this one is worth every penny. 10/10!

This has by far brought me countless hours of nostalgia and the ui is seamless! Only downside is not having the full utilization of my iPhone X screen... would love to see the devs put this into plan. If not stretching the screen, at least let me see toggles in the Black voids of the screen such as touch d-pad and access buttons
This gam cost me way too much for the constant crashes. Please fix this.

I'm not normally the type to leave reviews, but I just had to make an exception for this game. FFIX is one of my favorite games of all time. It's an absolute masterpiece. I could not be happier with this port. Best $20 I've ever spent.

I tried to download this app after deleting all my applications having 7.6 GB of space and the app still says it’s unable to download after the download takes 4 GB of your space and then installing it takes 3.9GB I think that’s ridiculous that I have to delete everything still can’t get the app to download and install. Such a waste of $20

I’m not getting any sound in the game. I’ve tried reinstalling it and everything but no dice. I absolutely love this game. My all time favorite, and the biggest dose of nostalgia possible. The soundtrack was my favorite part tho and is the only thing keeping this at 4 stars. Please fix! But other than that, the best purchase on the app store I’ve ever made.

About 13 hours in and really enjoying it. Thought I suddenly had one of the audio glitches mentioned in other reviews of no audio except when headphones were plugged in. Discovered after a while I had accidentally hit my mute switch.

Rarely don’t I write reviews but this game deserves it. Beautifully made game, and works so well with the mobile features. So easy to pick up for a few minutes without having to worry if you saved recently. Awesome features that let you cheat to get through grinding quickly, or skip random battles entirely. Movement controls are nicely done too. Played the original back on PlayStation, and I gotta say I love this version more!
Great story, characters get well developed, abilities are varied and apply well to the classes, overall great rpg

Love this game so much bought it through my iPhone 6s but, when I tried to download it through my iPad mini it would only sync data to 25% and then crash literally every time  would restart it same thing. If it could be fix please do so, so that I can continue playing.
Waste of money. Cleared out double the required amount of data and crashes at 25%. Not worth the hassle. Re-downloaded multiple times and multiple devices. Thanks for nothing.
Is so cool
What more can be said? This is the G.O.A.T. from the PS1.

Do not buy this app if you have an iPad mini 1st gen as its not supported. I didn't know this and am unable to run the app. My phone would work however you have to purchase the app again separately to play it on the phone. So basically I spent $20 on nothing.

If you enjoyed the PS1 version, you need to play this!!! The high-speed option is so awesome. Level grinding, retracing steps, chocobo digging, etc... all made so easy. Not a single glitch or problem, in over 110 hours of gameplay.
Great game! Do I miss the old controls from Playstation? Sure. Is it that big of a deal? Not really. They did a great job with this one!
Favorite final fantasy!

My device cannot find a save on it and my cloud saves are also missing. 

Truly unacceptable.
Gameplay is great but no audio on iPhone 7 plus.
Just spent $21 on game that won't load!  It crashes everytime at "25% Extracting Files." This needs to be fixed, are or Square Enix should refund every broken games.
Can you provide Chinese version?
I payed over twenty dollars for this and it doesn't even startup without crashing! It gets to 25%, then crashes! Horrible!
The hype is real

Stopped playing this game for a while and saved my file to the iCloud, when I went back to it couple months later the game isn't connecting to the iCloud so now I have to start over until that's fixed. So I deleted it until that update comes.
Still no fix yet come on square get this issue fixed!

Update 8/17
Still no iCloud connection.  I already checked my iCloud I have 2 gigs of ff9.  I click the iCloud save and the app says the connection timed out.  Square needs to fix this so I can properly finish this ff.  Still a one star until fixed

Updated visuals, new features (cheats, auto save, fast forward, skip movies), as well as optimized touch screen controls make this the best version of this game. Could not have asked for a better port of this classic.

They did an excellent job formatting this to an app. The fast forward feature, 9999 damage, instant trance, and no monster feature made this final fantasy game more fun! I just wish they had done same setup/company as FFX7. They only thing I would ask for is better graphics when in game play, but it did not impact my 5-star rating. 👍🏼
Very disappointed that this will not run on iPad second generation. Paid for, and downloaded...however this WILL crash on the extracting files screen when opened. Users beware!
Tried to download but will not get out of extracting file.... Stops at 25% then exits the app... Please fix or advise on how to fix. No one from customer support has helped

title.label: Best game on iPad I've played!

content.label:
Pros:
_Beautiful story.
_Good combat system. Not too complicated to master.
_Very entertaining in many ways. Either following main story or doing side quests.
_Easy to level up your characters.

Cons:
_Crashes a few times. Not sure if it's because of my old iPad or the game (I play on iPad Air 1). But not a big deal in general.

Overall:
_9/10
_Worth every cent! 
_I played this game on PS1 simulator more than a decade ago but didn't get to finish it (I think I stopped after disc 1). This time, I finished the main story (~50 hrs). The team porting this game to iOS did a great great job!
_Hopefully, they will remaster more PS1 and PS2 games in the future.
This game crashes before it even loads, paid 21$ just to watch it extract files to 25% before crashing. Doesn't even work. Please fix or refund the money! It was not cheap
I have always loved final fantasy IX but there is some issue that causes the game to crash every time it loads. Crash happens at 25% every time.

This game is my second favorite final fantasy as of right now. The graphics were spectacular, the weapon and ability system are extremely well done, the characters were all excellent, and the ending is probably the most satisfying ending i've ever seen in a game. Coming from me that's a lot, because i have never played a game and actually felt satisfied with an ending. The only complaint i have a is a small one, the enemies move very fast. That's all i can say. The story was just... amazing. I retract my first statement this is tied with 7 for my favorite final fantasy title, this game is a must buy.
